required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arthroscopic Treatment of Bursal-side Rotator Cuff Tears in Shoulder Joint
clinical_study.official_title: Arthroscopic Treatment of Bursal-side Partial-thickness Rotator Cuff Tears

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective analysis was performed on patients with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears who underwent arthroscopic surgery from January 2009 to December 2011. To investigate the diagnosis and arthroscopic treatment of partial rotator cuff bursa lateral tear, and to evaluate the postoperative functional outcome and tendon healing.

detailed_description.textblock: To study the surgical method and clinical effect of arthroscopic treatment for partial tear of rotator cuff bursa. A retrospective analysis was performed on patients bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears who underwent arthroscopic surgery from January 2009 to December 2011. Preoperative X-ray and MRI were performed. Rotator cuff repair was performed during the operation. UCLA shoulder scoring scale was used to evaluate the joint at preoperative and final follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles) Shoulder Score Scale at 1 year after operation.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles) Shoulder Score Scale at 1 year after operation. The scale has a minimum score of 2 and a maximum score of 35. The higher the score, the better the prognosis of the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles) Shoulder Score Scale at 2 years after operation.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles) Shoulder Score Scale at 2 years after operation.The scale has a minimum score of 2 and a maximum score of 35. The higher the score, the better the prognosis of the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles) Shoulder Score Scale at 5 years after operation.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles)Shoulder Score Scale at 5 years after operation. The scale has a minimum score of 2 and a maximum score of 35. The higher the score, the better the prognosis of the patients.

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears
arm_group.description: Patients with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears who underwent arthroscopic surgery and was followed up at Peking University Third Hospital.

intervention.description: Patients underwent ubacromial bursectomy and acromioplasty , cuff debridement and cuff repair, side to side suture of rotator cuff combined with suture anchor.
intervention.arm_group_label: patients with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears, there has been very little research on bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears, which has no consensus on diagnosis and treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- From January 2009 to December 2011, patients with bursal-side partial-thickness rotator cuff tears who underwent arthroscopic surgery at Peking University Third Hospital and were followed up.
exclude:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with frozen shoulder and unstable shoulder joints.
